thread.title: Holly Willoughby sparks speculation Kim Woodburn's personality is FAKED for cameras: 'It's all good TV'
thread.title_full: Holly Willoughby sparks speculation Kim Woodburn's personality is FAKED for cameras: 'It's all good TV'

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Holly Willoughby sparks speculation Kim Woodburn's personality is FAKED for cameras: 'It's all good TV'
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Everyone's been talking about Kim Woodburn this week after her appearance on This Morning. 
The CBB star had a massive go at Phillip Schofield after he pushed her for answers about her behaviour on the Channel 5 reality series. 
But when the cameras went off air, it appears as though Holly and Phil saw an entirely different side to the How Clean Is Your House star. Kim snapped at Phillip (Photo: Rex Features) She wasn't happy with him (Photo: Rex Features) 
Holly dished: "She was fine. She lent across and said 'I do like you Phil, I do like you'. Then she said 'it's all good telly' and I thought, maybe she is just being very clever." 
I was a bit scared. I could see her getting bigger and more upset and it was bubbling and growing and she was getting a bit cross. Phil didn't say anything he wouldn't have said to anyone else. 
"To be honest and I dont really know what happened, I didn't watch Big Brother this series so I hadn't seen any of that happening in the house and hadn't seen she had the potential to go. " 
But how about Phil? After all, he was the one who got the grilling from the reality star. The star was different off camera (Photo: Rex Features) Who really is she? 'This Morning' TV show (Photo: Rex Features) 
Thanfully, Holly explained that he shrugged it off like nothing had even happened. She said: "You never have an intention to upset somebody or make them cross or make them have that sort of reaction, you never want to do that. 
"But he felt, as did I, nobody had said anything we wouldn't have said to anyone else," she added. Like us on Facebook
